title: Phase 1 - The Use of Rhythmic Light Therapy to Entrain Gamma Oscillations and the Circadian System in Patients With Alzheimer's Disease
description_brief:
The investigator will investigate how light delivering 40 hertz (Hz) affects subjective sleep and cognition in a controlled laboratory study. A lab study will allow the collection of electroencephalogram (EEG) data, perform cognitive tests, and observe the response in those with mild cognitive impairment (MCI) compared to a healthy control group (HC).

Participants will attend two study sessions over the course of two weeks. During both sessions, all participants will experience 10 minutes of a low-level light, followed by a data collection period which involves a sleepiness rating, an electroencephalogram (EEG) recording, and a computerized memory test. Participants will then experience either a RL or a placebo RL condition for one hour, after which there will be a second data collection.
description_detailed:
The investigator will demonstrate the effect of 40 hertz (Hz) rhythmic light (RL) to promote gamma wave entrainment (rhythmic light \[RL\]) on: brain response (electroencephalography \[EEG\]); cognitive performance (working memory task); and subjective sleepiness (questionnaires). The study will recruit 20 adult mild cognitive impairment (MCI) patients and 20 healthy, age-matched controls (HC) to participate in this study.

Sessions will initiate with a 10-minute adaptation period to a low-level ambient light providing illuminance of 15 lux at participants' eye level on a vertical plane, followed by a pre-exposure data collection period, including Karolinska Sleepiness Scale (KSS), EEG, and a working memory task. Participants will experience either 40 Hz RL or placebo RL conditions for a duration of 1 hour, followed by the second data collection period. On the second data collection day, participants will experience the other condition, so that all participants experience both lighting conditions. The experimental sessions will start at 14:00 on each experimental day which will be separated by 1 week.

groups.title: Health Control Group 1
groups.description:
Healthy Control - Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting then Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting

1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants. then 1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants.

groups.title: Health Control Group 2
groups.description:
Healthy Control - Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting then Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting

1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants. then 1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants.

groups.title: Mild Cognitive Impairment Group 1
groups.description:
Mild Cognitive Impairment - Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting then Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting

1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants. then 1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants.

groups.title: Mild Cognitive Impairment Group 2
groups.description:
Mild Cognitive Impairment - Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting then Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting

1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants. then 1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants.

groups.title: Health Control
groups.description: Health Participants - 1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants or 1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants then in the second intervention experiences the opposite of the first intervention.

groups.title: Mild Cognitive Impairment
groups.description: Participants with Mild Cognitive Impairment - 1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants or 1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants then in the second intervention experiences the opposite of the first intervention.

categories.title: Native Hawaiian or Other Pacific Islander

outcomeMeasures.title: Change in Electroencephalography (EEG) Power at 40 Hertz (Hz)
outcomeMeasures.description: Electroencephalography (EEG) recordings - the change in 40 Hz gamma power, computed by calculating the difference between the average gamma power at baseline (T1) and during the light intervention (T2). This difference was obtained by subtracting baseline 40 Hz power from the intervention 40 Hz power to assess acute neural effects
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription: EEG data not collected for first 12 participants. Protocol revised to include EEG data collection subsequently.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: baseline and during the light intervention

groups.title: MCI - Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting
groups.description:
1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants.

Placebo Rhythmic Lighting Intervention: Placebo rhythmic light (RL) for a duration of 1 hour. In the placebo RL condition, the duty cycle will be delivered with a random interval determined by a Poisson process with an average interval of 40 hertz (Hz). The placebo RL conditions will provide a 30 lux of red light on a vertical plane at the eye level.

groups.title: MCI - Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting
groups.description:
1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants.

Tailored Rhythmic Lighting Intervention: 40 hertz (Hz) rhythmic lighting (RL) for a duration of 1 hour. The flicker frequency of the 40 Hz RL will be 40 Hz and the stimulation will be a square wave with a 50 % duty cycle (i.e., 12.5 milliseconds light- on and 12.5 milliseconds light-off). The RL will provide a 30 lux of red light on a vertical plane at the eye level.

groups.title: HC - Placebo Rhythmic Lighting
groups.description:
1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants.

Placebo Rhythmic Lighting Intervention: Placebo rhythmic light (RL) for a duration of 1 hour. In the placebo RL condition, the duty cycle will be delivered with a random interval determined by a Poisson process with an average interval of 40 hertz (Hz). The placebo RL conditions will provide a 30 lux of red light on a vertical plane at the eye level.

groups.title: HC - Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting
groups.description:
1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants.

Tailored Rhythmic Lighting Intervention: 40 hertz (Hz) rhythmic lighting (RL) for a duration of 1 hour. The flicker frequency of the 40 Hz RL will be 40 Hz and the stimulation will be a square wave with a 50 % duty cycle (i.e., 12.5 milliseconds light- on and 12.5 milliseconds light-off). The RL will provide a 30 lux of red light on a vertical plane at the eye level.

outcomeMeasures.title: Mean Change in Subjective Sleepiness Using the Karolinska Sleepiness Scale (KSS)
outcomeMeasures.description: The Karolinska Sleepiness Scale (KSS) outcome prompts participants to rate how sleepy or alert they are feeling on a scale ranging from 1 to 9, where 1 = "very alert," 3 = "rather alert," 5 = "neither alert nor sleepy," 7 = "sleepy, but no difficulty remaining awake," and 9 = "very sleepy, fighting sleep, an effort to remain awake."
outcomeMeasures.populationDescription:
EEG data not collected for first 12 participants. Protocol revised to include EEG data collection subsequently.

Outcome measure is comparing the two interventions Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting vs Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting regardless of cognitive status.
outcomeMeasures.timeFrame: Baseline and 1 hour after intervention (intervention is 2 hours)

groups.title: Active Tailored Rhythmic Lighting
groups.description:
1 hour intervention period where active lighting is experienced by participants.

Tailored Rhythmic Lighting Intervention: 40 hertz (Hz) rhythmic lighting (RL) for a duration of 1 hour. The flicker frequency of the 40 Hz RL will be 40 Hz and the stimulation will be a square wave with a 50 % duty cycle (i.e., 12.5 milliseconds light- on and 12.5 milliseconds light-off). The RL will provide a 30 lux of red light on a vertical plane at the eye level.

groups.title: Inactive Placebo Rhythmic Lighting
groups.description:
1 hour intervention period where an inactive, placebo lighting condition is experienced by participants.

Placebo Rhythmic Lighting Intervention: Placebo rhythmic light (RL) for a duration of 1 hour. In the placebo RL condition, the duty cycle will be delivered with a random interval determined by a Poisson process with an average interval of 40 hertz (Hz). The placebo RL conditions will provide a 30 lux of red light on a vertical plane at the eye level.

outcomeMeasures.title: Cognition Using a Working Memory Task
outcomeMeasures.description: Participants view a serial visual display of letters and math problems. They are asked to hold the letters in memory while simultaneously determining if the simple math problems are correct (e.g., 7+5=13). Performance is assessed in percent correct and by measuring accuracy and Reaction Time (RT).

pointOfContact.title: Mariana Figueiro PhD
pointOfContact.organization: Icahn School Of Medicine at Mount Sinai

drug: Rhythmic light therapy (40 Hz gamma entrainment)
explanation_target: Reason: The intervention is non-pharmacologic rhythmic light (RL) delivering 40 Hz to entrain gamma oscillations and the circadian system, with outcomes focused on subjective sleep, EEG entrainment, and cognitive tests. That goal (improving cognition/sleep by entraining neural activity) fits the "cognitive enhancer" category rather than a biologic or small molecule. citeturn0search1turn0search0

Act: Key details extracted from the description — intervention = 40 Hz rhythmic light (one-hour active or placebo/sham RL), participants = MCI and healthy controls, measures = EEG power at 40 Hz, sleepiness rating, computerized memory/working memory task. Similar 40 Hz light/sensory stimulation trials have been used in AD research and show EEG entrainment and signals of improved sleep/cognition (and in animal work, reduced amyloid/tau). citeturn0search1turn0search5turn0search2

Reflect: Classification check — the intervention is not a biologic (no antibody/vaccine) nor a small molecule drug, and it targets neural oscillations to improve cognition/sleep rather than treating agitation or other neuropsychiatric symptoms specifically. Therefore "cognitive enhancer" is the best-fit category. Note: some literature suggests potential disease-modifying effects in animal models and preliminary human biomarker signals, but the described trial's outcomes are cognitive and sleep-focused, supporting the cognitive-enhancer classification. citeturn0search0turn0search6

Web search results (selected sources used): 1) Trial listing for "Use of Rhythmic Light Therapy..." (MedPath/NCT summary) — describes 40 Hz RL, EEG 40 Hz power outcome and sham control. citeturn0search1 2) Chan et al. (2021) randomized study reporting 40 Hz light+sound entrainment affecting EEG, circadian rhythm, and cognition in mild AD. citeturn0search0 3) He et al. (2021) feasibility trial of gamma sensory flicker showing entrainment and preliminary network/immune effects. citeturn0search2 4) medRxiv / preprint and other reviews summarizing 40 Hz sensory stimulation (GENUS) literature and ongoing trials. citeturn0search5turn0search7
explanation_agent: Reason: The intervention is non-pharmacologic rhythmic light delivering 40 Hz to entrain gamma oscillations and explicitly to affect the circadian system and sleep/cognition; this aligns best with CADRO category O (Circadian Rhythm) because the trial's stated goal is entrainment of neural rhythms and the circadian system rather than a molecular target like amyloid, tau, inflammation, or a neurotransmitter receptor. citeturn0search5turn0search4

Act: Key extracted details — intervention = 40 Hz rhythmic light therapy (one-hour active or placebo/sham), participants = MCI and healthy controls, primary measures = EEG power at 40 Hz (entrainment), subjective sleepiness, and cognitive/working-memory tasks. Similar 40 Hz sensory (light/sound) entrainment trials show safety, EEG entrainment, improved circadian measures and cognitive/sleep signals in humans, supporting classification as targeting circadian/oscillatory systems rather than a molecular pathway. citeturn0search4turn0search0turn0search1

Reflect: The CADRO list includes a specific circadian rhythm category (O). Although gamma entrainment can have downstream effects on synaptic function or amyloid/tau in animals, the described human trial focuses on entraining neural oscillations and the circadian system to improve sleep and cognition — therefore O) Circadian Rhythm is the most specific and appropriate CADRO assignment. If the protocol had focused primarily on disease-modifying molecular biomarkers as its main target (e.g., amyloid reduction) one could consider other categories, but here the therapeutic target is neural/circadian entrainment. citeturn0search3turn0search6

Web search results (selected sources used): 1) Trial listing / study summary for "Rhythmic Light Therapy for Alzheimer's Disease Patients" (MedPath / NCT summary) — describes 40 Hz RL, EEG 40 Hz outcome and sham control. citeturn0search4 2) ICH GCP / trial registry summary for the Phase 1 Rhythmic Light Therapy study — detailed description of 40 Hz RL intervention, sleep and EEG outcomes. citeturn0search5 3) Chan et al., 2021 — randomized human trial of 40 Hz light+sound (GENUS) reporting EEG entrainment, improved circadian measures, structural MRI signals and cognition. citeturn0search0 4) He et al., 2021 feasibility trial of gamma sensory flicker in prodromal AD — safety, entrainment, and preliminary network/immune effects. citeturn0search1 5) medRxiv / preprint reporting 40 Hz sensory stimulation effects on entrainment, sleep, structure and cognition in mild AD — supports translational rationale. citeturn0search3
